label: A2B_oP24_26_2a2b2c_2a2b-001
title: $\gamma$-SeO$_{2}$ Structure
comments:
SeO$_{2}$ has been observed in three phases (Orosel, 2004): \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_tP24_135_gh_h-001}{Downeyite, $\alpha$-SeO$_{2}$, {\em Strukturbericht $C47$}}, the ground state, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_oP12_26_abc_ab-002}{$\beta$-SeO$_{2}$}, and \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B_oP24_26_2a2b2c_2a2b-001}{$\gamma$-SeO$_{2}$} (this structure). \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 The later two phases form at high pressures (up to 15GPa and 820$^{\circ}$C) but upon quenching and slowly reducing the pressure they remain metastable under ambient conditions. 
 Data for $\gamma$-SeO$_{2}$ was taken at 200K using powder diffraction data. 
 Space group $Pmc2_{1}$ \#26 allows an arbitrary choice for the origin of the $z$-axis.  Here we follow (Orosel, 2004) and set $z_{7} = 0$ for the Se III (2b) site.
